list_definition.mean_english: cuộc xổ số để bán hàng (nhất là vì từ thiện)
list_definition.definition: a way of raising money by selling numbered tickets, one or more of which win a prize

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I won this doll in a raffle

list_definition.mean_english: bán hàng bằng cách chơi xổ số
list_definition.definition: to give as the prize in a raffle

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: They raffled a bottle of whisky to raise money for cancer research.

list_ex_of_english: Cash prizes and a handmade quilt made by ladies in the community are raffled at the end of the day's events.
Often parcels of grocery that have been put in the bazaar on sale or return are made up and raffled in the ordinary way.
There is no doubt in my mind that the chief source of income of many worthwhile charities today comes from running these more or less small raffles.
The objects that are sold are so large that they cannot be bought by an individual and, therefore, they are raffled.
If he could continue this excellent good fortune, for instance, in raffles in his constituency, he would soon be a very rich man.
In just four years, they have raised more than £650,000 through all sorts of ordinary activities, such as raffles, jumble sales and tombolas.
Students are entered into raffles for free parking permits as long as the student has registered the vehicle and received no tickets for the year.
They should not have to support themselves through jumble sales and raffles.
